thread.title: As Rio nears, gymnastics' Biles is ready to take charge
thread.title_full: As Rio nears, gymnastics' Biles is ready to take charge

author: WILL GRAVES
title: As Rio nears, gymnastics' Biles is ready to take charge
text:
David J. Phillip As Rio nears, gymnastics' Biles is ready to take charge 
FILE - In this Sept. 12, 2015, file photo, U.S. gymnast Simone Biles trains at the Karolyi Ranch in New Waverly, Texas. (AP Photo/David J. Phillip, File) David J. Phillip As Rio nears, gymnastics' Biles is ready to take charge 
FILE - In this Sept. 12, 2015, file photo, U.S. gymnast Simone Biles trains at the Karolyi Ranch in New Waverly, Texas. (AP Photo/David J. Phillip, File) David J. Phillip As Rio nears, gymnastics' Biles is ready to take charge 
FILE - In this Sept. 12, 2015, file photo, U.S. gymnast Simone Biles, left, listens to Martha Karolyi, national team coordinator for USA Gymnastics, after a training session at the Karolyi Ranch in New Waverly, Texas. At home, she’s just a teenager who requested a belly ring after her first world title in 2013. The daughter whose chores include feeding the family’s four dogs. Stardom, the kind that truly changes a life, awaits Biles. (AP Photo/David J. Phillip, File) David J. Phillip As Rio nears, gymnastics' Biles is ready to take charge 
FILE - In this Sept. 12, 2015, file photo, U.S. gymnasts Aly Raisman, right, and Simone Biles stretch before a training session at the Karolyi Ranch in New Waverly, Texas. Stardom, the kind that truly changes a life, awaits Biles. The two-time defending world all-around champion will go for a three-peat at the 2015 championships in Glasgow, Scotland starting this weekend. (AP Photo/David J. Phillip, File) David J. Phillip As Rio nears, gymnastics' Biles is ready to take charge 
FILE - In this Sept. 12, 2015, file photo, U.S. gymnast Simone Biles, left, smiles as she talks with Gabby Douglas, right, during a training session at the Karolyi Ranch in New Waverly, Texas. Like most 18-year-olds, Biles has no idea what she wants to be when she grows up. For now, she is gymnastics’ Next Big Thing. (AP Photo/David J. Phillip, File) David J. Phillip As Rio nears, gymnastics' Biles is ready to take charge 
FILE - In this Sept. 12, 2015, file photo, U.S. gymnast Simone Biles, center, listens to Martha Karolyi, right, national team coordinator for USA Gymnastics, after a training session at the Karolyi Ranch in New Waverly, Texas. The two-time defending world all-around champion will go for a three-peat at the 2015 championships in Glasgow, Scotland, starting this weekend. The ever-growing speck in the distance that is the 2016 Summer Olympics creeps closer by the day. (AP Photo/David J. Phillip, File) David J. Phillip As Rio nears, gymnastics' Biles is ready to take charge 
FILE - In this Sept. 12, 2015, file photo, U.S. gymnast Simone Biles, center , talks with fellow gymnasts before a training session at the Karolyi Ranch in New Waverly, Texas. Biles has almost everything she’ll need for her journey. The infectious smile that already has sponsors writing checks. The accessible personality and the soaring routines that NBC’s high definition cameras will beam into millions of homes next summer. The talent to make her the next in a long line of American gymnastics royalty that stretches from Gabby to Nastia to Carly to Mary Lou. (AP Photo/David J. Phillip, File) David J. Phillip As Rio nears, gymnastics' Biles is ready to take charge 
FILe - In this Sept. 12, 2015, file photo, U.S. gymnast Simone Biles poses at the Karolyi Ranch in New Waverly, Texas. Stardom, the kind that truly changes a life, awaits Simone Biles. The two-time defending world all-around champion will go for a three-peat at the 2015 championships in Glasgow, Scotland, starting this weekend. (AP Photo/David J. Phillip, File) David J. Phillip As Rio nears, gymnastics' Biles is ready to take charge 
FILE - In this Sept. 12, 2015, file photo, U.S. gymnast Simone Biles poses at the Karolyi Ranch in New Waverly, Texas. Biles has almost everything she’ll need. The infectious smile that already has sponsors writing checks. The accessible personality and the soaring routines that NBC’s high definition cameras will beam into millions of homes next summer. The talent to make her the next in a long line of American gymnastics royalty that stretches from Gabby to Nastia to Carly to Mary Lou.(AP Photo/David J. Phillip, File) Posted: Wednesday, October 21, 2015 11:43 pm As Rio nears, gymnastics' Biles is ready to take charge Associated Press | 
CONROE, Texas (AP) — The little girl had to be in charge. It was her way of taking control. Of protecting her younger sister. Of trying to find order during a time when it was in short supply. 
So Simone Biles anointed herself the boss, ordering around little sis Adria in their new home to give her something familiar to hold onto. The girls, Adria still in diapers, were living with their grandparents in Texas while their mother struggled with addiction back in Ohio.
